input_text:
Job Title: Senior Database Administrator

Location: Orange County, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Consulting, Information Technology

Description:
I'm recruiting for a $7B International technology manufacturer. Their products help people stay safe and connected. They are building a centralized global product hub in Orange County for product R&D/ Operations/Administrative/Software Development. The new office will be pivotal in propelling the group's global ventures, invites you to join our mission in shaping a technology-driven future.They believe technology changes the world for the better, and are committed to crafting dependable, high-performance products to connect users worldwide with the wonders of technology.
Overview:In this role, you'll be a key player in maintaining and optimizing our cloud-based databases. You'll leverage your expertise to troubleshoot issues, ensure high availability, and collaborate with business departments to align database solutions with strategic goals.
Here's what you need to qualify:Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related technical field.Minimum 5 years of experience administering database systems like MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.Familiarity with NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, Cassandra, DynamoDB, Redis) and practical experience with their operation is a plus.Proficiency in Linux administration, including service deployment, troubleshooting, and performance tuning.Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Shell, Python, Java) for scripting and automating database operations.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively under pressure.Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Responsibilities:Proactively identify and troubleshoot database faults to minimize downtime and maintain optimal performance.Continuously monitor and optimize database performance for scalability, efficiency, and responsiveness.Partner closely with business departments to understand their needs and ensure database availability aligns with business goals.Collaborate on database architecture enhancements to support evolving requirements.Provide technical support and training to development teams, fostering a strong understanding of database best practices.Lead the construction and ongoing maintenance of our database platform in the cloud environment.Participate in the development of database operation and maintenance products and related components.Lead the construction and ongoing maintenance of our database platform.Stay up to date on emerging database technologies and products to identify opportunities for improvement and support business growth.
Here's what you'll be earning:Salary range: $210,000 - $300,000 (dependent on experience) + bonusFull suite of paid benefits including PTO and 401kAn opportunity to make a lasting impact within a start up environment backed by an industry leader

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Senior Database Administrator
output_json.summary: Key player in maintaining and optimizing cloud-based databases, troubleshooting issues, ensuring high availability, and collaborating with business departments.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related technical field
required_skills: Minimum 5 years of experience administering database systems like MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.
Familiarity with NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, Cassandra, DynamoDB, Redis) and practical experience with their operation
Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Shell, Python, Java) for scripting and automating database operations
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
soft_skills: Manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
job_responsibilities: Proactively identify and troubleshoot database faults to minimize downtime and maintain optimal performance.
Continuously monitor and optimize database performance for scalability, efficiency, and responsiveness.
Partner closely with business departments to understand their needs and ensure database availability aligns with business goals.
Collaborate on database architecture enhancements to support evolving requirements.
Provide technical support and training to development teams, fostering a strong understanding of database best practices.
Lead the construction and ongoing maintenance of the database platform in the cloud environment.
Participate in the development of database operation and maintenance products and related components.
Lead the construction and ongoing maintenance of the database platform.
benefits: Full suite of paid benefits including PTO and 401k
An opportunity to make a lasting impact within a startup environment backed by an industry leader
output_json.company_information: International technology manufacturer focusing on product R&D, operations, administrative tasks, and software development.
